articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli military strikes on Jabalia, Beit Hanoun and Beit Lahiya have killed around 800 people during a three-week offensive, the Gaza health ministry said.
articles.title: Israeli strikes kill dozens in north Gaza as raid deepens, medics say

articles.author: Phil Stewart, Humeyra Pamuk
articles.description: Hours after Iranian missiles rained down on Israel on Oct. 1, President Joe Biden's administration sent an urgent message to Israel: Take a breath.
articles.title: How Biden pushed Israel to calibrate its strikes on Iran

articles.author: Sakura Murakami
articles.description: Political wrangling could roil markets and be a headache for the Bank of Japan.
articles.title: Japan votes in election expected to punish PM Ishiba's coalition

articles.author: Felix Light, Lucy Papachristou
articles.description: The Georgian Dream party received more than 54% of the vote in a parliamentary election on Saturday.
articles.title: Georgian ruling party wins election, near-complete results show

articles.author: Ari Rabinovitch, Adam Makary
articles.description: Israel's airstrikes "hit hard" Iran's defences and missile production, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Sunday, but Iranian Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei said the damage from Saturday's attack should not be exaggerated.
articles.title: Netanyahu says Israel hit Iran hard; Khamenei says damage should not be exaggerated

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin said Moscow is coming up with various ways to respond should the United States and its NATO allies allow Ukraine to use long-range Western weapons to strike deep inside Russia, according to remarks published on Sunday.
articles.title: Putin: We will respond if Ukraine allowed to make long-range strikes in Russia

articles.author: Catarina Demony
articles.description: Some British Labour lawmakers on Sunday accused Prime Minister Keir Starmer of having a "colonial mindset" and trying to silence nations pushing for discussions on reparations for transatlantic slavery at this month's Commonwealth summit in Samoa.
articles.title: British lawmakers accuse Starmer of 'colonial mindset' in slavery reparations debate

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: The United Nations Security Council is expected to meet on Monday to discuss Israel's attack on Iran, diplomats said on Sunday.
articles.title: UN Security Council expected to meet Monday over Israel's strike on Iran, diplomats say

articles.author: Thomas Escritt
articles.description: It shaped modern industrial design and continues to inspire architects and product designers the world over, but to some on Germany's far right, Bauhaus is nothing to celebrate.
articles.title: Germany's far right stirs up culture war over Bauhaus legacy

articles.author: Jonathan Landay
articles.description: One expert said the strikes may have hampered Iran's ability to mass-produce missiles.
articles.title: Exclusive: Satellite photos show Israel hit Iran missile fuel-mixing facilities, researchers say
